isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-8609 SERIES - AIR SYSTEM - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: If the transmission fails to make a range shift or shifts too slowly, the fault may be in the Range Shift Air System or actuating components of the shifter housing assembly.
To locate the trouble, the following checks should be made with normal vehicle air pressure applied to the system, but with the engine off.

warning.para: NEVER WORK UNDER A VEHICLE WHILE THE ENGINE IS RUNNING as personal injury may result from the sudden and unintended movement of vehicle under power. Always place transmission in the neutral position.

svcsubproc.title: Incorrect Air Line Hook-Ups
svcsubproc.para: With the gear shift lever in neutral, move the control that provides range selection UP and DOWN.

item.para: If the air lines are crossed between the control valve and slave valve, there will be CONSTANT AIR flowing from the exhaust port of the control valve WHILE IN HI RANGE.

If the air lines are crossed between the slave valve and range cylinder, the transmission gearing will not correspond with the range selection. A LO RANGE selection will result in a HI RANGE engagement and vice versa.

svcsubproc.title: Air Leaks
svcsubproc.para: With the gear shift lever in neutral, coat all air lines and fittings with soapy water and check for leaks, moving the control that provides range selection UP and DOWN.

item.para: If there is a steady leak from the exhaust port of the control valve, O-rings and/or related parts of the control valve are defective.
If there is a steady leak from the breather of the slave valve, an O-ring in the valve is defective, or there is a leak past the O-rings of the range cylinder piston.
If the transmission fails to shift into LO RANGE or is slow to make the range shift and the case is pressurized, see Check No. 7 of this section.
Tighten all loose connections and replace defective O-rings and parts.

svcsubproc.title: Air Filter/Regulator
svcsubproc.para: With the gear shift lever in neutral, check the breather of the air filter/regulator assembly. There should be NO AIR leaking from this port. The complete assembly should be replaced if a steady leak is found.

Cut off the vehicle air supply to the air filter/regulator assembly, disconnect the air line at the fitting in the Supply OUTLET and install an air gauge in the opened port. Bring the vehicle air pressure to normal. Regulated air pressure should be 57.5 to 62.5 PSI.

DO NOT ADJUST THE SCREW AT THE BOTTOM OF THE REGULATOR TO OBTAIN CORRECT READINGS. The air regulator has been PRE-ADJUSTED within the correct operating limits. Any deviation from these limits, especially with regulators that have been in operation for some time, is likely to be caused by dirt or worn parts. If replacement or cleaning of the filter element does nothing to correct the air pressure readings, replace the complete assembly, as the air regulator is non-serviceable.

svcsubproc.title: Range Valve
svcsubproc.para: With the gear shift lever in neutral, select HI RANGE and disconnect the air line at the OUTLET or "P" Port of the control valve.

item.para: When LO RANGE is selected, a steady blast of air will flow from the opened port. Select HI RANGE to shut off the air flow. This indicates the control valve is operating properly. Reconnect the air line.
If the control valve does not operate properly, check for restrictions and air leaks. Leaks indicate defective or worn O-rings.

svcsubproc.title: HI Range Operation
svcsubproc.para: With the gear shift lever in neutral, select LO RANGE and disconnect the 1/4 inch I.D. air line at the port of the range cylinder cover. Make sure this line leads from the HI Range or "H" Port of the slave valve.

item.para: When HI RANGE is selected, a steady blast of air should flow from the disconnected line. Select LO RANGE to shut off the air flow.

Move the shift lever to a gear position and select HI RANGE. There should be NO AIR flowing from the disconnected line. Return the gear shift lever to the neutral position. There should now be a steady flow of air from the disconnected line. Select LO RANGE to shut off the air flow and reconnect the air line.
If the air system does not operate accordingly, the slave valve or actuating components of the shifter housing assembly are defective.

important.para: The plunger pin, located in the case bore between the slave valve and actuating plunger of the shifter housing, prevents the slave valve from operating while the shift lever is in a gear position. When the lever is moved to or through the neutral position, the pin is released and the slave valve becomes operational.

svcsubproc.title: LO Range Operation
svcsubproc.para: With the gear shift lever in neutral, select HI RANGE and disconnect the 1/4 inch I.D. air line at the fitting on the range cylinder housing. Make sure this line leads from the LO Range or "L" Port of the slave valve.

item.para: When LO RANGE is selected, a steady blast of air should flow from the disconnected line. Select HI RANGE to shut off the air flow.

Move the shift lever to a gear position and select LO RANGE. There should be NO AIR flowing from the disconnected line. Return the gear shift lever to the neutral position. There should now be a steady flow of air from the disconnected line. Select HI RANGE to shut off the air flow and reconnect the air line.
If the air system does not operate accordingly, the slave valve or actuating components of the shifter housing assembly are defective.

svcsubproc.title: Range Cylinder
svcsubproc.para: If any of the seals in the range cylinder assembly are defective, the range shift will be affected.

item.para: A leak at O-ring A results in complete failure to make a range shift; steady flow of air from the breather of the slave valve in both ranges.
A leak at gasket B results in a steady flow of air to the atmosphere while in HI RANGE.
A leak at O-ring C results in a slow shift to LO RANGE; pressurizing of the transmission case.
